I have changed the logic for health check creation. So health checks are created using the port map configuration related to the application instead of using the user provided port.
Thanks Milindu for your contribution! This pull request is now merged to stratos-4.1.x branch. It will be released with 4.1.4.
Closing this p/r as it is outdated.

Closing this p/r as it is merged.
Closing this p/r as it is outdated.
Integration test SingleClusterScalingTestCase is continuously failing with this. Can you check whether integration tests are passing?
I have started to look into this.
I'm able to successfully build from stratos-4.1.x branch (including tests). But this PR fails continuously at SingleClusterScalingTestCase.

I was able to solve "Too many open files issue" when running integration test locally yesterday. I ran integration-test twice today, for me also SingleClusterScalingTestCase fails with the below error:

Failed tests: 
  SingleClusterScalingTestCase.testDeployApplication:114->assertClusterWithScalingup:206 » ThreadTimeout

I'm checking this further.

Akila I am able to build stratos 4.1.x branch after merging this p/r without any test failures in a clean repo. I have tried to build several times and couldn't produce the above timeout issue also (SingleClusterScalingTestCase.testDeployApplication:114->assertClusterWithScalingup:206 » ThreadTimeout) after clean repo build.

Great work Akila! Few points:
- Did we remove existing complete topology publishing logic? May be this can be removed now.
- Did we update PCA to work with this model?

Thanks

Hi Imesh,

Do we plan to remove existing, periodically published complete topology?

Thanks.
Closing this p/r as it is merged in commit 0c64d22653d706542f3f7d7b7f99195cab660cad and 270066786b35aafe185240632348e0fd8460408.

We cannot remove existing, periodical complete topology event publish task. Because there might situations where CC is not active (maintenance restarts, failures etc.) and if clients publish complete topology request event, it might get ignored.
I've updated PCA to use this initialization mechanism. Also updated PCA live test to verify the functionality.
Thanks for the info Akila.

Thanuja, Thanks for the PR. Can you write a unit test or integration test to assert the multiple DAS node functionality?

@anuruddhal Thanks for the contribution, looks like your changes are now conflicting with the modifications in the master branch. Would you mind updating them?
Thanks
@ravihansa3000 Currently I'm writing testing to check multiple DAS node data publishing. Will send a p/r.
@imesh These changes are already in the master branch. I will close this PR.
